entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
Hi @wagener-mark ,

these are 2 different parameters: 

- for "releasedAPIDataSource" you can either use "checkedSystem" for released APIs in the system or provide the URL if you want to check against the newer version (e.g. your system is S/4HANA 2023 but you want to check with released APIs for the S/4HANA 2025).

- for "classicAPIDataSource" use classic APIs list (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SAP/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc/refs/heads/main/src/objectClassifications_SAP.json)

Kind regards,
Olga.

entry.title: Assistance Required for Saving Layouts in Review Booklet App
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

I am currently working with the Review Booklet application in SAP S/4HANA and facing difficulty in saving or bookmarking a custom layout. While I do see an option to "Save as Tile" on the SAP Fiori Launchpad, attempting to use this feature results in an error, and the layout is not saved.

In comparison, the Group Data Analysis (GDA) app allows bookmarking and saving layouts seamlessly, which helps in quick access and reuse. I was expecting similar functionality in the Review Booklet app but could not locate any alternative options to save or personalize the layout.

 

Could you kindly guide me on:

  • Whether layout saving/bookmarking is supported in the Review Booklet app
  • If so, what is the correct procedure to save a layout or create a bookmark
  • Any known issues or prerequisites that might be causing the error when using "Save as Tile"

Additional question

Why the error occurs (showing that the problem is with SAP and not us).

Please inform us the correct way to save these layouts, if creating them as templates is the correct way.

 

Your assistance in resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated.

 

thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Re: How to switch off message no AA577 enter trading partner
entry.content:
You're encountering the ‚ÄúEnter trading partner‚Äù warning because the document type used (A*) has the ‚ÄúInter-company postings‚Äù or ‚ÄúEnter trading partner‚Äù indicator enabled. This requires the system to validate that a trading partner is entered in the master data (typically in the company code segment of the asset or vendor/customer master).

What you can do is go to AS02 > Company Code view. Ensure the Trading Partner field is filled under the control data section. Alternatively, if intercompany logic is not needed, you can remove the ‚ÄúEnter trading partner‚Äù indicator from the document type in configuration via OBA7.

entry.title: Re: ABAP Proxy generation support with SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi @AGAS82  -  When the service interface artifact is imported from PI/PO to Cloud Integration , it gets imported with all the dependant objects(Message type ,Datatypes....) . It is possible to edit the Datatype and Message Types artifacts  in Cloud Integration  and the same will be reflected in the SPROXY navigation tree. The Proxies for these artifacts (if already generated) will be shown as Proxy Outdated in case of any changes to them in the Cloud Integration workspace.

Edit and Create of the Service Interface will be after 15Nov2025.

entry.title: Cost Element Category Change in S/4 Hana
entry.content:
Hi All

Is there a way to change cost element category in S/4 Hana? I see that the system allows the change of cost element category currently in S/4 Hana 2020 however SAP suggests following-

a) Either make the change at your own risk. I am not sure why they allow this change if there is any risk. So we won't use this option.

b) Change validity period of cost element. For Example-Change validity end date of cost element to 10/31/2025 & create same cost element from 11/01/2025 to 12/31/9999. However this option is not valid in S/4 Hana so not for us.

c) Delete/reverse transactional data of cost element which won't do as we have lot of data. So this option also not for us.

d) Change cost element category before any new posting in new FY but after closing the existing FY which is practically impossible.

Any other option or work around from anyone? Basically we want to change from cost element category 11 to 01 as G/L with cost element category 11 doesn't work in allocation cycle (Tcode-KSV5). 

Regards

Pankaj

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation reading Excel data from Sharepoint using Microsoft 365 Cloud SDK
entry.content:
I am building an automation in SAP Build Process Automation that should automatically read data from an Excel file stored in SharePoint. I used this tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-office-integration-agent..html

Previously, I used the ‚ÄúGet Remote File Information‚Äù activity, where I could directly provide the file URL to specify the exact Excel file in SharePoint.

Now, I want to modify my process so that it automatically retrieves the most recently added Excel file from the same SharePoint location (instead of using a fixed link), so I tried to replace ‚ÄúGet Remote File Information‚Äù with ‚ÄúGet Recent Files‚Äù.

However, the ‚ÄúGet Recent Files‚Äù activity does not have a field for entering a SharePoint URL or folder path, so I am not sure how to define the correct source location from which the automation should fetch the file. I also don't know how to adjust properly the new parameters, didn't see any tutorials on the Internet regarding this..

entry.title: SAP Business ByDesign Expense reports in new currency for Bulgaria
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

As of 1st of January 2026 Bulgaria will have a new national currency - Euro. We have a Bulgarian company in Business Bydesign and currently are testing the currency transition. It is done via transitioning to a new company code. 

We encountered an issue with expense reports. The employee for whome the expense report is being created was hired in Personnel Administration for Bulgaria with old currency(BGN), so the reimbursement and settlement amount is automatically  exchanged to BGN in spite of his/her working company (where we have set up EUR currency). The currency of a country is a system setting that we cannot change.

Question is will these system settings of currency for Bulgaria be updated by SAP automatically after 01.01.2026? Or else can we do something about it?

entry.title: Good receipt and label printing for mixed purchase orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

we often have the issue of purchase orders with mixed item positions: Regular production material mixed with free text orders from purchase requisitions of end users in one purchase order.

‚ÄÉIn this case there is no label printing possible for regular production material during goods reciept, only a document for Goods Receipt for PO is printed.

The workaround is to post incoming goods in 2 steps, 1st all freetext order items and 2nd all regular production material. But this means one must look into the entire item list of the purchase order to identify the freetext items, this is somehow cumbersome and laborious.

Is there a smarter way to achieve the printing of goods receipt labels for mixed purchase orders?

Thank you.

BR

Dirk

entry.title: CALM custom check consistencies
entry.content:
Hello dear Experts,

i have requirement to made custom consistency checks in CALM with same mechanism as in SolMan.
I find only some recomendations that i have to use API.
In SolMan it works following way:
1. user is changing status in Task or Feature
2. 1st action execute check for next status. For example, if for the next status some fields have correct data (or any other logic to do in external app). If not - user got message that to go to the next status he need to fill some data.
3. if 2nd all cases for next status correct - status for Task go the next one

And here i have questions:

How and where i can made action which will work for Task in CALM?
Is it possible to return to CALM from external app result that going to next status is possible o not?
Do you have schema with SAP products (i mean do we need here to use Workflow or any)?
Do you have probably some examples or guides how to made trigger when status was changed and how to process it?

entry.title: HOW TO solve error that access sequence inconsistent, target field missing while performing m/07
Re: What does "APF Buffers Found in Cache" (in sp_sysmon)...
entry.content:
Looking at the SAP Knowledge Base note 2456551 (High threads/engine CPU usage and Spinlock contention - SAP ASE) it says:

"APFs are used mostly for DBCCs and table scans. When there are table scans on tables that are entirely in cache engine utilization can be so high that the ASE appears hung"

and then gives the example:

Data Cache Management
---------------------
  Cache Statistics Summary (All Caches)
  -------------------------------------
    Asynchronous Prefetch Activity
      APF Buffers Found in Cache
                                  per sec      per xact       count  % of total
                             ------------  ------------  ----------  ----------
        With Spinlock Held            0.0           0.0           6       0.0 %
        W/o Spinlock Held           627.3           3.2      376401      96.9 %

this would seem to imply that, when scanning a table in cache, you should expect a high "APF Buffers Found in Cache" count. This in turn implies that "APF Buffers Found in Cache" really means "APF buffer reads not performed because the buffer was already in Cache"

I.e,, a high "APF Buffers Found in Cache" is good because it means the APF disk read was skipped because the data was already in cache.

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: Robotic Integration for EWM
entry.content:
With the request to further increase the level of automation in modern and high-performance warehouses integration of robotics to warehouse management solutions becomes increasingly relevant.

This demand is leading to the question on how to best and most efficiently integrate robotics, fleet management systems and multi-agent orchestration platforms to SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

With this blog post, we would like to discuss some of the most important and relevant questions of the topic of robotic integration to SAP EWM.

What is the right integration technology to integrate robotic systems to SAP EWM?

With SAP EWM there are multiple channels and interfacing options that should be evaluated when integrating robotics and the corresponding fleet management systems.

Typically, robot platforms are integrated via OData APIs, EWM-WCU IDOC interface or via SOAP Webservices and RFCs. Further AGV, AMR and robots can be integrated using MFS over TCP/IP and telegram-based communication. Find further information about available EWM interfaces and specific features and functions via the following links:

  • OData APIs for EWM: Find a list of available ODATA Services for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - APIs for Warehousing or via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • EWM WCU IDoc Interface: Find a list of available IDocs for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - Interface Between EWM and Non-SAP Systems.
  • SOAP Webservices for EWM: Find a list of available SOAP for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - Enterprise Services in Extended Warehouse Management.

The choice of the integration technology is majorly influenced by the dedicated robotic vendor (integration to sub-systems), partner solution, requirement against end-to-end visibility, type of robotic integrated/primary function (e.g. mobile robot, manipulation robots, cognitive robots, etc.), size and heterogeny of robotic fleet.

Is there a best-practice architecture for robotic integration?

While the robotics integration is highly depending on the aspects mentioned before in the warehouse context the following types of robots are typically used (listed based on primary function):

  • Mobile Robots: Robots moving through the warehouse such as AMR (Autonomous Mobile Robots), AGV (Automated Guided Vehicles)
  • Manipulation Robots: Robots that physical handle and move items such as picking robots, sorting robots and palletizing/depalletizing robots.

In case there are larger and heterogenous robotic fleets integrated to warehouse solutions there are often Fleet Management Systems (FMS) or Multiagent Orchestration Platforms (MOP) from SAP Partners required to orchestrate and dispatch Workload (Warehouse Orders/Tasks) amongst the integrated fleet, performing position management, analytics, routing and training of robots.

Additionally, there are partner solutions on the market that are specialized on industries and process variants such as eCommerce small parts picking, which can be integrated according to a Black Box-integration pattern (EWM viewpoint), as Warehouse Orders/Tasks are optimized and dispatched via the Fleet Management System (FMS) to an integrated robotic solution (e.g. assisted picking robots).

Considering above mentioned aspects, the following integration patterns are most common and best suiting to the requirements of robotic integration:

                Event-Driven Integration

The event-driven integration considers direct distribution of relevant workload via the Warehouse Order Business Event (available with SAP S/4HANA 2025, FPS0) to the SAP Event Mesh on SAP BTP. From the SAP Event Mesh the Fleet Manager System (FMS) can pick-up the relevant Warehouse Order creation, cancelation, activation or deletion events to initiate retrieving relevant Warehouse Orders.

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. Push Warehouse Order Business Event to SAP Event Mesh
  2. FMS to register for the relevant Warehouse Order Business Event from SAP Event Mesh
  3. Perform Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks retrieval from FMS for relevant Warehouse Orders via the Warehousing API (GET)
  4. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit) by the Warehousing API (POST) (optional)
  5. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS by the Warehousing API (POST)

Direct Integration

In basic concept of the direct integration is to either send created Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks to a Fleet Management System (FMS) or retrieve Warehouse Orders/Tasks by the Fleet Management System (FMS).

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. FMS to select open Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks regularly from queue via EWM interface (e.g. ODATA-service, WebService, IDoc).
  2. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by setting updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit)
  3. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS

Additionally, there are project-based integrations possible, to integrate robotics via MFS-telegrams or with small robotic fleets to directly integrate robots to EWM.

What is the typical SAP EWM configuration required for robotic integration?

To enable transparency and optimized integration the following customizing is typically configured in SAP EWM:

  • Queues and Queue determination criteria for robots
  • Resource Types for robots
  • Resource Groups for robots
  • Queue sequence for robot‚Äôs Resource Group
  • Resource for robot

Implementation of the following interface functions to connect robots with SAP EWM:

  • Push Warehouse Order Events (create, change, delete, activate) to FMS
  • Retrieve Warehouse Orders
  • Assign Robot to Warehouse Order
  • Confirm Warehouse Orders

We are currently evaluating further enhancements to standard functionality on SAP EWM roadmap to improve integration to robotic fleets to enable for a more robust and dynamic integration.

Are there partner solutions available to integutions to SAP EWM most efficiently?

We have partner solutions offering proven integration concepts and contents available via our SAP Store with the following partners:

Partner

Solution

Locus Robotics, Inc.

Locus Autonomous Mobile Robots for SAP EWM

Geekplus Technology Co., Ltd.

Improve efficiency of your warehouse operation by 2 to 3 times

DXC Technology Services LLC

DXC Smart Warehouse EWM Integration with AGVs

Flexus AG

AGV-Hub - Fleet Manager for Mobile Robots

KINEXON Industries GmbH

Connect and automate operations: redefine manufacturing & logistics efficiency

Roboteon Inc.

Roboteon Fulfillment Platform

Beside these there are implementation accelerators and partner solutions available from our partner ecosystem that are not listed yet in the SAP Store.

What is the future of robotic integration with SAP EWM?

With advancing technology both in logistics, business solutions and robotics, new ways of integration are explored and driven forward. SAP‚Äôs initiative to combine advanced robotics with enhanced sensorics and AI capabilities ‚Äì cognitive robots ‚Äì and AI-infused logistics solutions leads the way towards new opportunities for automation.

BITZER, NEURA Robotics and SAP went live with a proof-of-concept solution to integrate embodied AI agents to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition. The proof-of-concept validates Joule-based multi-agent orchestration and execution via the humanoid robot 4NE1 for a picking workflow including visual inspection, enabling agentic situation handling according to the business process and priorities. If you would like to learn more about via SAP News - SAP Expands Physical AI Partnerships and Demonstrates Success of New Robotics Pilots. 

If you would like to learn more about robotic integration, please find more information via SAP Community Blog Enhancing warehouse operations by integrating robotics with SAP Extended Warehouse Management or stay tuned for further release updates and posts.

entry.title: Quantity Confirmation Beyond Tolerance Not Stopping in Order POD
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Requirement:- We have a requirement where, during quantity confirmation from the Order POD, if the user enters a quantity beyond the tolerance limits of the order quantity, the system should block the posting to S/4HANA and display an error message or popup to the end user.

Current Issue:-When users post confirmations from the Order POD, even if the quantity entered is beyond tolerance, the POD displays the confirmation as successful, whereas the IMD shows the message as failed as we enabled the config checks in OPK4  ‚ÄúError when overdelivery /underdelivery tolerance is exceeded‚Äù . This causes confusion for end users, as they are not notified of the failure.

Workaround Attempts: 

  • Tried utilizing all available possible plugins including quantity confirmation plugins, but none were able to stop the posting if it exceeded tolerance limits. 
  • Checked the quantity validation field in Manage Routing, which only works when ‚ÄúStart One Operation at a Time‚Äù is enabled.
  • Tested using the Post Production POD, but the behaviour remains the same.

     

    Note:- We are using Order POD for Production orders and all the Collaboration Links are as per help doc.

    Please help us with the possible solutions that can help us achieve the requirement:

    Thank you in advance for your guidance and support.

entry.title: Re: story report : filter error
entry.content:
Hi, I finally raised a support ticket.

The SAP agent asked me to change a setting. So this may be of interest to some of you.

open the story report, in edit mode, open settings,  query settings. Select "Disable Batch Settings".

This may slow down the report a bit, but it will update all data from the server rather than the cache, this is at least what I understood from the explanation.

So good luck.

Kris

entry.title: Re: Extraction of attribute and entity comments via SQL -...

Hello,

The comment identifier is stored in the PMOBJT.CMMT column and the associated text is in PMTEXT.TDAT.
Here is an example,

SELECT o.name, o.code, l.tdat
FROM pmobjt o, pmtext l
WHERE o.cmmt = l.txid -- AND o.clss = 1125 -- Filtering on Entities

If you have installed the PD Examples on your machine, you can open the model 'Repository Metamodel.pdm' and browse the whole repository definitions.

Kind regards

entry.title: Re: Wave templates in WM SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Good day @ST24 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Schedule Wave Creation, Configuration for Wave Management, Wave templates

Based on the details and screenshots you provided, the behaviour you have explained is expected in public cloud due to how the system handles dynamic date selection and wave time attributes. It is important to know that wave completion date is a fixed target date and the template time attributes are relative to the Goods Issue Date of the delivery document. Which explains why the system is not filtering based on GI date by default.

To summarise, the wave completion date is not a selection filter, it is a scheduling reference for wave timing. The system includes all PDOs eligible for wave creation even if their GI date differs. Dynamic filtering by Goods Issue Date is not supported in public cloud WM.

The best practice is to adhere to clean-core approach which entails you using the Manage Outbound Delivery Orders or Warehouse Monitor apps to pre-filter PDOs by GI date before wave creation.

See below description for step-by-step clean-core approach:

Search for Manage Outbound Delivery Orders (this option focuses on running scheduled wave creation with pre-filtered Warehouse Request Selection).

Filter by Planned Goods Issue Date = 04.11.2025

Select the filtered PDOs --> choose Create Wave from the action menu. This will trigger wave creation only for the selected documents. The system applies the Wave Template automatically based on your configuration.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Calculation formulas for Statistical Key Figures in m...
entry.content:
Greetings, @byd !

 

1) Statistical Key Figures in overhead cost allocation support two primary calculation approaches:

Statistical Key Figures | SAP Help Portal

Fixed Values (Category 1): Generally constant values throughout the year, such as number of employees or square meters occupied. You enter values for the first fiscal period and the system copies them to future periods. The fiscal year total represents an average of period totals.

Total Values (Category 2): Variable values posted for each period, such as kWh energy consumption or machine hours. Each period requires separate posting, and the fiscal year total represents the sum of all period values.

 

2) I Highly recommend checking out the documentation bellow, as it provides important information about the calculation methods:

Cost Rates | SAP Help Portal

Actual Price Calculation: Determination Method

 

3 and 4) This community post addresses all the relevant information regarding the available options in Public Cloud:

Solved: automatic calculation of plan activity rates - SAP Community

 

I hope it helps!

entry.title: Re: automated testing error in action type During the aut...
entry.content:
Good day @1144171145 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Automated Test Cases

Resolve Errors in DEFAULT User Maintained in Test Automation Tool

Based on the information you provided, please check that you have added a wait condition or synchronization, you have re-identified the button using the live control preview or resetting user UI variants to expose the header section.

To summarise, the error occurs because the automation tool cannot find the Expand Header (UI element) when executing the click action. It is usually caused by UI timing, app updates, or personalization differences.

Also consider verifying if SAP has delivered an updated test script for your process. This is often the case after each release.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris
